title: Back up the OO deployment before upgrade
content:
Follow these steps to back up the OO Containerized deployment before upgrading:

  1. Back up oo-secret. Run the following command: 
    kubectl get secret oo-secret -o yaml -n <oo_namespace> > oo-secret_backup_yyyy-mm-dd.yaml

    For example:

    kubectl get secret oo-secret -o yaml -n oo-prod > secret_backup.yaml
  2. Back up external databases. See the PostgreSQL documentation for instructions on backing up the database.
    PostgreSQL version 14
    PostgreSQL version 15
    PostgreSQL version 16
    PostgreSQL version 17
  3. Back up all the configuration files that you are using. For example, values.yaml file.
    Run the following command to get values.yaml file from the OO deployment: 
    helm get values <oo_install_name> -n <oo_namespace> > /path/to/previous_deployment_values.yaml

    Back up the yaml file from this location.

  4. Back up the volumes.yaml file. Run the following command: 
    cp oo-helm-charts-1.x.x-26.x.x/oo-helm-charts-1.x.x-26.x.x/oo-helm-charts/samples/persistent_storage/<deployment_type>/volumes.yaml volumes.yaml
    Where <deployment_type> is aks, eks, or on_premises.
  5. Back up the claims.yaml file. Run the following command: 
    cp oo-helm-charts-1.x.x-26.x.x/oo-helm-charts-1.x.x-26.x.x/oo-helm-charts/samples/persistent_storage/<deployment_type>/claims.yaml claims.yaml
    Where <deployment_type> is aks, eks, or on_premises.
  6. Back up data on the following NFS volumes for the OO deployment:
    oo-config-volume storing OO Containerized configuration files. Example path: /var/vols/itom/oo/oo_config_volume.
    oo-data-export-volume storing OO tenants exported data. Example path: /var/vols/itom/oo/oo_data_export_volume.
    oo-data-volume storing storing OO generated data. Example path: /var/vols/itom/oo/oo_data_volume.
